author: Reuters
title: WhatsApp says Russia is trying to block it - NewsBreak
text: MOSCOW (Reuters) -WhatsApp said Russia was trying to block its services because the social media messaging app owned by Meta Platforms offered people's right to secure communication, and vowed to continue trying to make encrypted services available in Russia. Russia has started restricting some Telegram and WhatsApp calls, accusing the foreign-owned platforms of failing to share information with law enforcement in fraud and terrorism cases. "WhatsApp is private, end-to-end encrypted, and defies government attempts to violate people's right to secure communication, which is why Russia is trying to block it from over 100 million Russian people," WhatsApp said in a statement. "We will keep doing all we can to make end-to-end encrypted communication available to people everywhere, including in Russia." (Reporting by Reuters; editing by Guy Faulconbridge)
topics: Science and Technology->information technology and computer science

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Impact of the Holidays on Mental Health Lasts Beyond Christmas
text: (Atlantic) While the Holidays are a time of celebration and joy for a lot of people, it can also be a period of stress, sadness, or loneliness. According to Senior Life Solutions Program Therapist Kacey Peterson, The impact of the holidays on mental health lasts beyond Christmas Day. Peterson says there are five strategies that can help support your mental health. The next strategy is to develop a plan. This plan includes recognizing if you are someone who suffers from seasonal mood changes. If you do, Peterson recommends determining your triggers and thinking of ways to respond if the holidays are difficult. Peterson added, “Doing things you value can make the difficult moments a little more manageable.” The third strategy includes getting involved with your community. The fourth strategy is to practice some self care, by prioritizing your health and well being. Peterson says this can include “watching your diet, getting plenty of rest, spending time in nature, practicing stress management skills, and staying away from substances like alcohol and drugs.” The final strategy focuses on seeking help from those around you. If you or a loved one is struggling with mental health, visit www.hhs.iowa.gov/programs/mental-health for mental and behavioral health resources in Iowa.
